title: Virginia Chadwyck-Healey on why buying a size up could make your outfit look more expensive
text:
The great conundrum: when does a dress fit and when does it veer into oversized and shapeless (whilst undoubtedly comfortable and curry-night friendly)? Here is a prime example of how a dress can totally morph into a very different 'look' simply through a larger size.

This is the superbly named ‘Goldfinch’ midi dress by British brand Goat. Notice how in one small step the whole style shifts from day wear (pink) to smarter evening wear (blue). The camellia print fabric is the same, albeit in different colours, and both sizes do technically 'fit'.
